channel.title: How to fix your client from crashing! FIXES HS_ERR_PID FROM X64 USER!
channel.description:
Credits: 100% Pro Banana as he is too scared of Moderators to post it in tutorials section.
Hi,do you also have that annoying crash ? after you clicked 2 times in your client?
Well I also had the problem once though ,and i'm here to explain why.
Most run applications look like this: [code] Quote: @echo off Start java -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui exit [/code]
This code "only" works on 32 machines. (on some 64machines should it work) Why? because this piece of code follows this path: programfiles/java/jre6...... Now We are on a OS that haves a Program Files (x86). So this code should work.
[code] @echo off cls "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe" -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui exit pause [/code]
If it still doesnt work here some envoirement variables you might want to add.
CLASSPATH [code] C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_13\bin [/code]
CLASSPATH
[code] CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_13\bin;%CLASSPATH%; [/code]
If you set your variables you will only need to have:
[code] java -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui [/code]

item.title: How to fix your client from crashing! FIXES HS_ERR_PID FROM X64 USER!
item.dc:creator: @imsokool22 imsokool22
item.description:
@imsokool22 wrote:

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:5, topic:331545”]CHANGING the path settings doesn’t prevent it from crashing… Downloading the right Java does
THE PATH SETTINGS DOESNT PREVENT IT FROM CRASHING…DOWNLOADING THE RIGHT JAVA DOES[/quote]
Owner v0id, don’t argue with him i know he’s right because i had that same prob.(2 steps crsh) on my laptop and i downloaded the right java and it fixed it.Nothing else would work. and for hector download the 32 bit java, on a 64 pc will work just fine, trust me thats what i did.

Read full topic

item.source: How to fix your client from crashing! FIXES HS_ERR_PID FROM X64 USER!

item.title: How to fix your client from crashing! FIXES HS_ERR_PID FROM X64 USER!
item.dc:creator: @Superd00d Superd00d
item.description:
@Superd00d wrote:

deathschaos9:

Changing the path settings doesn’t prevent it from crashing… Downloading the right Java does

For 64 bit users no. In the run.bat, there’s something like

@echo off Title Your client cd Files Start javaw -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui
64 bit computers cant find javaw, so you instead replace it with…

@echo off Title Final Speced cd Client Files "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe" -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui
And that fixes everything.

Read full topic
item.source: How to fix your client from crashing! FIXES HS_ERR_PID FROM X64 USER!

item.title: How to fix your client from crashing! FIXES HS_ERR_PID FROM X64 USER!
item.dc:creator: @0wner_v0id 0wner v0id
item.description:
@0wner_v0id wrote:

Credits: 100% Pro Banana as he is too scared of Moderators to post it in tutorials section.

Hi,do you also have that annoying crash ?
after you clicked 2 times in your client?

Well I also had the problem once though ,and i’m here to explain why.

Most run applications look like this:

Quote:
@echo off
Start java -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui
exit

This code “only” works on 32 machines. (on some 64machines should it work)
Why? because this piece of code follows this path: programfiles/java/jre6…
Now We are on a OS that haves a Program Files (x86).
So this code should work.

@echo off
cls
"C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe" -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui
exit
pause

If it still doesnt work here some envoirement variables you might want to add.

CLASSPATH

C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_13\bin

CLASSPATH

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_13\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

If you set your variables you will only need to have:

java -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui

Read full topic
